Key Arguments: The report argues that there is a causal association between the COVID-19 vaccine rollout and an increase in all-cause mortality in Australia.

It claims that there was no detectable excess mortality during the first 13 months of the pandemic, but a significant increase in mortality coincided with the vaccine rollout starting in mid-April 2021.
The authors provide a vaccine injection fatality ratio (vIFR) of approximately 0.05%, suggesting that the vaccines are causing deaths.
They argue that the excess mortality is not due to COVID-19 itself, as the number of deaths registered as from or with COVID-19 is less than half of the excess deaths observed.
The report dismisses alternative explanations, such as heatwaves, for the observed mortality peaks.
Main Themes: Criticism of Government and Health Authorities
Notable Quotes: The excess mortality in the vaccination period (mid-April 2021 through August 2022) is more than twice the total number of deaths registered as being from or with COVID-19.
The step-wise increase in all-cause mortality is synchronous with the COVID-19 vaccine rollout.
Our analysis leads us to conclude that the excess mortality in the vaccination period...are causally associated with the COVID-19 vaccine.
